definition.text:
Abundant; copious; plentiful; sufficient for every purpose; as a plenteous supply of provisions; a plenteous crop.

1. Yielding abundance; as a plenteous fountain.
The seven plenteous years. Genesis 4 1:3 4.

2. Having an abundance.
The Lord shall make thee plenteous in goods. Deuteronomy 2 8:11.

3. Possessing in abundance and ready to bestow liberally. PsalmsÂ  8 6:5.
[This word is less used than plentiful.]
